intro: Aster chilensis var. sonomensis, commonly known as the Sonoma aster, is a perennial herb native to the western United States, particularly California. It is characterized by its showy, violet-blue to purple flower heads that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
